question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
For some positive integers $m$ and $n,$
\[\sqrt{23 + \sqrt{28}} + \sqrt{23 - \sqrt{28}} = \sqrt{m + \sqrt{n}}.\]Enter the ordered pair $(m,n).$
inference:
Starting with the left-hand side,
\[\begin{split} \sqrt{23 + \sqrt{28}} + \sqrt{23 - \sqrt{28}} & = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \left( \sqrt{46 + 2\sqrt{28}} + \sqrt{46 - 2\sqrt{28}} \right) \\\ & = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \left( \sqrt{(7+\sqrt{28})^2} + \sqrt{(7-\sqrt{28})^2} \right) \\\ & = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \left( 7 + \sqrt{28} + 7 - \sqrt{28} \right) \\\ & = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \cdot 14 \\\ & = \sqrt{14}. \end{split}\]

Therefore,
\[\sqrt{14} = \sqrt{m + \sqrt{n}} \Rightarrow 14 = m + \sqrt{n} \Rightarrow m = \boxed{6} \text{ and } n = \boxed{16}.\]
Final Answer: $\boxed{(6,16)}.$ I hope it is correct.

question:
Starting with the left-hand side,
\[\begin{split} \sqrt{23 + \sqrt{28}} + \sqrt{23 - \sqrt{28}} & = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \left( \sqrt{46 + 2\sqrt{28}} + \sqrt{46 - 2\sqrt{28}} \right) \\\ & = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \left( \sqrt{(7+\sqrt{28})^2} + \sqrt{(7-\sqrt{28})^2} \right) \\\ & = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \left( 7 + \sqrt{28} + 7 - \sqrt{28} \right) \\\ & = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \cdot 14 \\\ & = \sqrt{14}. \end{split}\]

Therefore,
\[\sqrt{14} = \sqrt{m + \sqrt{n}} \Rightarrow 14 = m + \sqrt{n} \Rightarrow m = \boxed{6} \text{ and } n = \boxed{16}.\]
Final Answer: $\boxed{(6,16)}.$ I hope it is correct.
